article.headline: Binghamton 71, UMBC 51
article.story: BINGHAMTON, N.Y. -- Emanuel Mayben had 18 points, Reggie Fuller added 12 points and 16 rebounds, and Binghamton beat UMBC 71-51 on Thursday night. It was the eighth straight victory for the Bearcats (20-8, 13-3 America East), who earned a share of the regular-season conference title and top seed in the America East tournament. Two free throws by Darryl Proctor gave UMBC a 2-0 lead 1:12 into the game. Mayben then hit a jumper, and D.J. Rivera, who finished with 14 points, sank a 3-pointer to give the Bearcats the lead. They never trailed again. Mayben's 3 at the first-half buzzer gave Binghamton a 27-19 edge, and UMBC never got closer than five points the remainder of the game. Proctor paced UMBC (12-16, 6-9) with 18 points.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
